background-color-is-set.description: All text must appear on top of a solid color
background-color-is-set.impact: The default background color for most browsers is white but this value can be overridden, if a solid background color is not used, then the color that is used as default cannot be determined and may make the text unreadable
background-color-is-set.message: The document has a solid background color

buttons-have-accessible-names.description: All buttons must have accessible names
buttons-have-accessible-names.impact: When a button is encountered by the screen reader, either when reading a section of a page or when it is focussed, its label is read. If there is no label, it will be unclear what the button will do or where it will take the user.

passedAssessments.detail: This button's accessible name is "Sign-In"
This button's accessible name is "Get an OTP in your email"

form-inputs-have-accessible-names.description: All form inputs must have accessible names
form-inputs-have-accessible-names.impact: When a form input is encountered by the screen reader, either when reading a section of a page or when it is focussed, its label is read. If there is no label, it will be unclear what the purpose of the input is.
form-inputs-have-accessible-names.message: All form inputs have accessible names

passedAssessments.detail: This input's accessible name is "Password"
This input's accessible name is "Keep me signed in. Details"

form-inputs-have-visible-labels.description: All form inputs must have visible labels
form-inputs-have-visible-labels.impact: Some users who encounter form input require explicit context to understand what an input needs, this may include users with cognitive impairments or any user who may have a reduced understanding due to cultural, language, or age differences. A label which is visible at all times is required, a placeholder or other labels which are not always present will cause confusion for some users.
form-inputs-have-visible-labels.message: All form inputs have visible labels

passedAssessments.detail: This input's label is "Password" and is labelled by { label.a-form-label[for="ap_password"] }
This input's label is "Keep me signed in. Details" and is labelled by { label.a-form-label[for="auth-remember-me"] }

headings-have-accessible-names.description: All headings must have accessible names
headings-have-accessible-names.impact: Headings are used by screen reader users as navigational elements, if the heading is empty navigation becomes much more difficult.

passedAssessments.detail: This heading's accessible name is "Sign-In"
This heading's accessible name is "or"

image-has-accessible-name.description: All images must have accessible names
image-has-accessible-name.impact: Images convey information to users, if users do not know the context of the images on a page they may miss important details.

passedAssessments.detail: This image's accessible name is "Amazon"

image-has-user-friendly-accessible-name.description: All images must have useful accessible names
image-has-user-friendly-accessible-name.impact: Images convey information to users, if an image description is too long, does not contain relevant information, or contains redundant information, a screen reader user may find the experience frustrating or miss out on vital details.
image-has-user-friendly-accessible-name.message: All images have useful accessible names

passedAssessments.detail: This image's accessible name is "Amazon"

links-have-accessible-name.description: All links must have accessible names
links-have-accessible-name.impact: When a link is encountered by the screen reader, either when reading a section of a page or when it is focussed, its label is read. If there is no label, it will be unclear what the link will do or where it will take the user.

passedAssessments.detail: This link's accessible name is "Amazon"
This link's accessible name is "Change"
This link's accessible name is "Forgot your password?"
This link's accessible name is "Details"
This link's accessible name is "Conditions of Use"
This link's accessible name is "Privacy Notice"
This link's accessible name is "Help"

links-have-user-friendly-accessible-name.description: All links must have useful accessible names
links-have-user-friendly-accessible-name.impact: When a link is encountered by the screen reader when it is focussed, its label is read. If the label does not make sense outside of the context that it is in, it will become difficult for users to understand what it does or where it will take them.
links-have-user-friendly-accessible-name.message: All links have useful accessible names

passedAssessments.detail: This link's accessible name is "Amazon"

list-structure-accessible.description: All list containers and list items in those containers must have valid markup
list-structure-accessible.impact: Assistive technology users can better navigate pages where lists are marked up appropriately
list-structure-accessible.message: Satisfactory markup found for all list elements

minimum-contrast.description: All text must have a minimum contrast ratio between the text color and the underlying background color
minimum-contrast.impact: Customers who have low vision may not be able to see the text. If they can see it, they may struggle to read it.
minimum-contrast.message: Minimum contrast met for all nodes

no-keyboard-trap.description: Web pages should not contain keyboard traps
no-keyboard-trap.impact: Keyboard traps prevent users who cannot use a mouse from navigating away from an interactive component which make it impossible for the user to access all parts of the page.

no-missing-header-markup.description: Elements that qualify stylistically as headings should be marked up as heading elements
no-missing-header-markup.impact: Assistive technology users can better navigate pages where headings are used appropriately
no-missing-header-markup.message: Satisfactory heading markup found for all applicable page elements

title-exists.description: An HTML document requires a title
title-exists.impact: The document title helps users to orient themselves within the site quickly without having to search for orientation information in the body of the page.

passedAssessments.detail: The document title is "Amazon Sign-In"

videos-have-captions.description: All videos with audio tracks must have caption tracks
videos-have-captions.impact: When individuals who have hearing impairments or simply are in a situation where they cannot use audio, videos without captions will not be understood and important information may be lost.
videos-have-captions.message: There are no videos present on the page

background-color-is-set.message: The document has a solid background color
